text:
{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM>
  <NR>20.</NR>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Falckeisische Bibel</TITLE>
    <BINDING>
      <FORMAT>Schweins-leder</FORMAT>
    </BINDING>
    <COND>noch gantz neu in Schweins-leder gebunden</COND>
    <PRICE>12. Gulden</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
  <ALT>
    oder gegen einem neuen
    <BIBL>
      <TITLE>Corpore Juris</TITLE>
      <PLACE>Leipziger Edition</PLACE>
    </BIBL>
    zu vertauschen.
  </ALT>
</ITEM>","number_of_corrections":6,"explanation":"1) Wrapped the leading number '20.' in a new <NR> tag to separate it structurally from the item text. 2) Split the binding information into a <BINDING> container and kept the existing <FORMAT> tag inside it to make the material designation more explicit. 3) Extracted the descriptive phrase 'noch gantz neu in Schweins-leder gebunden' into a new <COND> (condition) tag, as it describes the state of the book rather than its title or format. 4) Corrected the misspelled tag <PRIZE> to the more standard <PRICE> while preserving its content '12. Gulden'. 5) Introduced an <ALT> (alternative) tag around the barter/alternative offer starting with 'oder gegen einem neuen ... zu vertauschen.' to distinguish the exchange option from the main sale offer. 6) Placed the second mentioned work 'Corpore Juris, Leipziger Edition' into its own nested <BIBL> with <TITLE> and <PLACE> tags, matching the bibliographic structure of the first book. The stray Unicode characters (checkmark/dagger) were removed as noise and the XML was reformatted for clarity and validity."}

parsed.fixed_xml:
<ITEM>
  <NR>20.</NR>
  <BIBL>
    <TITLE>Falckeisische Bibel</TITLE>
    <BINDING>
      <FORMAT>Schweins-leder</FORMAT>
    </BINDING>
    <COND>noch gantz neu in Schweins-leder gebunden</COND>
    <PRICE>12. Gulden</PRICE>
  </BIBL>
  <ALT>
    oder gegen einem neuen
    <BIBL>
      <TITLE>Corpore Juris</TITLE>
      <PLACE>Leipziger Edition</PLACE>
    </BIBL>
    zu vertauschen.
  </ALT>
</ITEM>
parsed.explanation: 1) Wrapped the leading number '20.' in a new <NR> tag to separate it structurally from the item text. 2) Split the binding information into a <BINDING> container and kept the existing <FORMAT> tag inside it to make the material designation more explicit. 3) Extracted the descriptive phrase 'noch gantz neu in Schweins-leder gebunden' into a new <COND> (condition) tag, as it describes the state of the book rather than its title or format. 4) Corrected the misspelled tag <PRIZE> to the more standard <PRICE> while preserving its content '12. Gulden'. 5) Introduced an <ALT> (alternative) tag around the barter/alternative offer starting with 'oder gegen einem neuen ... zu vertauschen.' to distinguish the exchange option from the main sale offer. 6) Placed the second mentioned work 'Corpore Juris, Leipziger Edition' into its own nested <BIBL> with <TITLE> and <PLACE> tags, matching the bibliographic structure of the first book. The stray Unicode characters (checkmark/dagger) were removed as noise and the XML was reformatted for clarity and validity.
